intro: Odontadenia speciosa, commonly known as the mountain devil, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features dense, woolly foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers in summer. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in arid conditions. Odontadenia speciosa is also known for its ability to regenerate after bushfires.
